website_summaries.verdict: Versatile and easy-to-use unit that cranks out hard-boiled eggs and even poaches. Durable, too. Without question the best on the market.
pros: Versatile – can hard boil 10 eggs, make an omelette, or even poach eggs
Features alert system that calls you over to keep eggs from overheating
cons: More expensive than other egg cookers

customer_reviews.title: What Happended
customer_reviews.text: I just got mine. I watched the video. I went and bought Distilled Water. I followed the instructions. I used the cup to make a hole in the pointed top of the egg. Added the correct amount of water... I turned it on. The water over flowed....and look at my eggs. I only did 7 eggs....They are not even cooked all the way through.....Please help....I am so disappointed...
customer_reviews.author: Juliana Benson

customer_reviews.title: If I could give this no stars I would! ...
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this no stars I would! I bought this after seeing my sister in-law use her's perfectly, mine on the other hand doesn't work at all! The first one I returned assuming it was defective but, alas the new one has the exact same problems! Just tried to cook 10 eggs again, nearly all of them cracked and many of the egg whites cooked out the little pierced hole! Was making deviled eggs and when I cut the more decent looking eggs in half, the yoke wasn't completely cooked! Getting rid of this and going back to cooking them in a pot!
customer_reviews.author: Pebbles

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My son needed a new egg cooked. According to him, a similar model would “scream like someone being attacked” when the eggs were cooked. I gave him this for Christmas, and we set it up to use and wait for any “screams”. I will say our first attempt was a hot mess. We followed instructions and poked hole in shell on small end, placed with smaller end up. The egg boiled out of the shell like a party favor squirting out. Huge mess. Second time we put eggs in with small end on bottom and poked hole in larger end, large end up. Worked perfectly, zero mess. Happy to report no “screaming”.
customer_reviews.author: acwibw

customer_reviews.title: I am more cracked then this Cusinart egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing at all about this cooker I dislike. I just decided I would pass some pertinent information on. After using this machine on several occasions I did something really stupid. As I was trying to pierce the eggs I found that it was not breaking through the eggs outer shell. When I checked I had left the plastic protective device on and was trying to pierce through eggs and of course it is meant to be removed and most likely thrown out! I had kept replacing it after every use so I could store it in a drawer and not prick my finger. Try to beat this stupidity!
customer_reviews.author: Bob Charley

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately I was right in kitchen so i switched it ...
customer_reviews.text: This one caught on fire after a few days of use. Fortunately I was right in kitchen so i switched it off and threw it in trash.
customer_reviews.author: pj9

customer_reviews.title: Why have I struggled with boiling eggs for so long?!
customer_reviews.text: These eggs came out PERFECT!!! I didn't pierce them, put them fat side up, and used distilled water (there will be smelly brown water residue if you don't). I am floored at how perfectly these cooked and how quick it is to cook them! They peel flawlessly, in fact, the shells just fall off. Why did I not get this sooner? I have been struggling for so long with boiling eggs and throwing them all away when they refuse to peel. I thought there was a science to it, but all I needed was this little contraption. Bonus: it is beautiful and lightweight. LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: CMT926Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Egg Cooker
customer_reviews.text: We originally purchased an Elite Cuisine ECG 508 as it had great ratings on Amazon, but we had to return it as only held 4 eggs (claimed 7), was hard to clean and eggs would break open. This Cuisinart is much better made, holds the stated capacity, easy to clean and makes perfect eggs without cracking the shells. The only negative point is the unit must be manually turned off when it beeps or it will restart once it has cooled.
customer_reviews.author: Leo Berz

customer_reviews.title: Its and egg that cooks eggs!
customer_reviews.text: After some limited online research, I noticed immediately that the Cuisinart CEC-10 egg steamer was in the top 3 of all online reviews ( mostly at " #1 Best"). It turned out to be a great little egg cooker. Audible tone to tell you when the eggs are done, and if you like hard boiled eggs without all the hassle of boiling, this little cooker makes them Literally Perfect. STRONGLY recommend to use Distilled Water Only. Normal tap water / even bottled or filtered drinking water leaves a gross brown, white, burnt residue that does not clean up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Schenk

customer_reviews.title: Still the best egg cooker ever!
customer_reviews.text: Cooks 10 eggs in shells to a hard, medium or soft consistency with the 600-watt heater - Perfect Poaching tray with 4-egg capacity and omelet tray with 3-egg capacity - Pretty Good Brushed stainless steel lid; - Perfect for cooling boiled eggs blue LED indicator, audible alert and standby mode - Perfect Built-in cord storage for easy cleanup - Really short Cooker includes a 180 ml measuring cup with piercing pin - Perfect NOTE: Please ensure to measure rice in the cup that comes along with the product ONLY - Oops (note for the rice cooker)
customer_reviews.author: Gabby Golddigger

customer_reviews.title: It's eh.
customer_reviews.text: I have only used to cook hard and soft boiled eggs. I didn't notice anything with the hard boiled eggs but all the soft boiled eggs came cooked differently. Some were hard boiled, some soft and some under cooked. I would think this thing should cook them evenly. Raw eggs are not good to eat either so they were waste ): I really wanted to love this thing ): Hopefully the poached function works well (the main reason I purchased it).
customer_reviews.author: My Can

customer_reviews.title: Don't ever want to live without this.
customer_reviews.text: I love eggs - all kinds of eggs - cooked through any method. This is a dream come true. It takes less than 15 to have the PERFECT hard boiled eggs. Poached eggs come out perfectly. Nothing has failed to come out right. You absolutely cannot walk off and leave this though - when it completes the cooking process (whichever you choose), the unit beeps and flashes the light until you turn it off. I don't want to try and see how long it takes to turn off - I would rather not break or burn the unit. Clean up is easy - but it DOES leave deposits that you will need to use vinegar to remove every so often.
customer_reviews.author: H. Fouts

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this - it is dangerous to use
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy this...it does not live up to the Cuisinart name. I burned myself on the lid from the steam when opening it. I have a blistered finger from the steam. Not worth the chance of that happening again. It is not at all like the cheap version I have used for years. What was Cuisinart thinking?
customer_reviews.author: Rosierobins

customer_reviews.title: Read the instructions!
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased 3 of these, two for different households and one as a gift. The one as a gift the person thought it was the slickest thing ever! When I was reading the reviews there was some discussion about the proper way to pierce the egg, one person didn't read the instructions and had difficulty and the other person did read the instructions and had no issues at all. Just saying----
customer_reviews.author: chirolady

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love!
customer_reviews.text: I am constantly asked to make deviled eggs for parties and it has always made me cringe - especially for those bigger parties where you need to me upwards of 100. WOW this thing is a lifesaver! I used this to hard boil 60 eggs in a row and each egg was cooked absolutely perfectly and the shells slid right off! I was worried about using it back to back but I did ten eggs each time with only a few minutes between each use and they turned out beautifully. I've also used this to make soft boiled eggs for homemade ramen and poached eggs for breakfast and everything was perfect. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: J.Harrison

customer_reviews.title: This is eggs-actly what you need!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! Have had mine for 6 months and still works perfectly. Many reviewers note that they have eggs-perienced an eggs-plosion. You have to place the eggs in with the skinner part of the egg facing DOWN. The instructions do say this, but it is not emphasized. If you place the eggs skinny side up it will cause problems, from what I have read. I have never had a problem. Follow the instructions eggs-actly and you will be fine. Happy egg making to you all!
customer_reviews.author: PrincessD

customer_reviews.title: Great egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: Works great and cooks fast. We only use it for hard boiled. Leaks water occasionally, but I think it has to do with the size and shape of the eggs. We get ours from our own chickens, so sometimes they aren't as big as store bought and often don't have a distinct top and bottom shape. When we use store bought large eggs and place them fat side up, we've never had a leaking issue. I don't poke them with the needle provided and have never had an issue. About one out of every batch will crack, but I just eat that one right away!
customer_reviews.author: Marina's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and good cooking
customer_reviews.text: I have an egg cooker and like it so much for boiling eggs (poaching takes some experimenting with the water amount). I decided to get one for my daughter-in-law for Christmas. I know, it is way early. Her birthday is coming August 1 so maybe I will give her that for her birthday. Anyway, I have not used this brand but I do love my egg cooker and my granddaughter said her mom will love it because she boils eggs a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Donna D

customer_reviews.title: A good egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: I find that this is a good egg cooker. However, I felt it was rather slow. Recently, I was in Germany, and my friend had an egg cooker that was so fast. Therefore, I bought it after returning. What I can say is that it is not fast but it does cook the eggs well. You do need to follow the instructions that are provided. I felt the lid was cheaply made. But, then I felt it is how things are often made today. But because it is slow, I went back to boiling eggs the conventional way. However, you can make your eggs in many different ways. All in all, I can say it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: I'm not one to review everything I buy, but
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes, something just WORKS.....I've been through every gadget in the world for poaching eggs, and it seems like the eggs always end up with either runny whites or solid yolks, with no in between. Until now, that is......This thing just works. You have to experiment with the water level a bit, but once you learn how much to use, it makes perfect poached eggs. Boiled eggs? No problem, put in the water add eggs, flip the switch. Once done, put in running water until cool and peel immediately....perfect boiled eggs. It does OK with the omelet tray also, but I will still fry my omelette's..... As always, YMMV
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get the right consistency on a poached egg
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old cheap egg poacher. I thought this one is nice and I love Cuisinart. However, this has a design flaw. I loved the fact that it poached 4 eggs at a time rather than the usual 3. -- That is the design flaw though. The cups are so deep that even using a larger amount of water the eggs are still runny and that also means the white is sometimes still runny. I have to let it sit for at least 5 minutes before the eggs are done. I do use Costco eggs which are bigger, but I didn't have this problem with my little cheapie. It is cute though.
customer_reviews.author: zoki

customer_reviews.title: Cute and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Love that my hard boiled eggs are thoroughly cooked and not so "hard". I keep a jug of distilled water to use in this. It should last awhile because this is the only thing I use distilled water for. I haven't tried the other trays, but the eggs I've cooked so far have been very consistent. I use the cup piercer and it seems to work fine. The steel finish and black are consistent with my other small appliances, so I like that. It has been simple to clean for me. What else can I say? I like Cuisinart products, as well last Oster and KitchenAid. You should buy what you like, your'e probably going to have it for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: KissaMewTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart CED-Q0 CENTRAL EGG COOKER
customer_reviews.text: I used to own one of these and I used it all the time but it broke in transit when I moved a few years back and I've boiling eggs in a pot which isn't as good. They tend to crack. This comes with a little built-in puncture tool so the eggs not only don't get bumped around but the tiny bit of air prevents any cracking. I'm glad I saw it by accident on Amazon. I wouldn't have thought to get a replacement. Having it encourages me to make egg salad more frequently and it's something we enjoy. Same brand as the old one I had. Never a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Customer since 1918

customer_reviews.title: Peeling Eggs is Now Easy
customer_reviews.text: I have one that I love. So I purchased this for a friend. My original one was gifted to me, and I thought it was just a gimmick, so I was hesitate to use it. Once I did, I loved it. The best part is how easy the shells peel...I make a lot of deviled eggs, and peeling was always a pain...not a 100%, but close. I should buy stock in the company, as I am always telling everybody I know. I don't use distilled water, so I just make sure to rinse right-away to keep the mineral build from happening.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleR

customer_reviews.title: This can over cook.  Be careful!
customer_reviews.text: My friend has one that works perfectly which is what made me order one. I followed the instructions to the letter - twice - but it overcooked my eggs both times. I'm hopeful my replacement works much better.
customer_reviews.author: Shireen

customer_reviews.title: Great for boiling, ok for all else
customer_reviews.text: I would only buy this if you boil eggs frequently. The other cook styles like poached are not worth the effort to me. Cleaning it isn’t easy. The plastic parts aren’t too bad but the base stains. But yes, it does work. It will take you a few tries to figure out the timing you prefer for your eggs. The measuring cup provided isn’t very helpful. After buying this, we bought a stovetop poacher. Only use this Cuisinart for boiling multiple eggs at a time now.
customer_reviews.author: RadMom5

customer_reviews.title: Volcano of hot water, busted egg mess!
customer_reviews.text: Wow I thought I had found a diamond in the rough but after 4 uses it decided to turn into a weapon. Theres a hole at the top which releases steam as the eggs cook but instead of just steam it shoots out boiling hot water like a volcano. As the temperature rises the water boils inside & seriously explodes out the top. Water leaks out all over the countertop then theres none left inside so the egg shells bust open & ooze out egg white all over the eggs shell...oh & the bottom of the machine then scorches. What a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic litte egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: We love this egg cooker. My favorite way to make them is hardboiled, in no time do you have perfect hard boiled eggs. My kids like the omelets, if you add cheese do it at the end when it is done, it just ends up in a ball in the middle. My husband tried the soft and thinks he would add a little less water, but said they were good. We have used it many time with great ease and success each time.
customer_reviews.author: Momwith2boys

customer_reviews.title: LESSON LEARNED!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd Cuisinart egg cooker I have purchased. This one lasted from about March 13 2019 to April 20 2019. The timer device that indicates that the eggs are cooked would turn on when you turned on the machine. I put it in the trash and was going to order another one when I realized I had not had it very long. NO product no return on merchandise.!
customer_reviews.author: Steven P Calelly

customer_reviews.title: Value for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t buy another one, the poach egg part working fairly good. Boiled 6 eggs in it and ended up with more water on my counter than on the eggs. So much steam and water come out of the top hole it’s sprays all over. Followed all directions and still had a mess, the egg leaked out of the holes you have to punch in the top of the egg. The yokes fell to the bottom of the egg, I will go back to the old method of boiling my eggs, was very dissatisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Buonocore

customer_reviews.title: Does not have Auto shut off
customer_reviews.text: I got this egg cooker because I got tired of boiling my own eggs and either they were over cooked or under cooked Then It was a pain to peel the shells off of them no matter if I used vinegar and/or salt in the water the shells always stuck to the egg. This cooker makes great hardboiled eggs and the eggs don't stick to the shell so they are a ease to peel. CON: This unit does not have auto shut off... I didn't think of this until I had already used it.
customer_reviews.author: WeSeyDogs

customer_reviews.title: Snacking on perfect medium eggs!!
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were easy. The equipment was easy to assemble. Perfectly cooked medium eggs. Some tips: puncture the round end of the egg (the end that is pointing up in the egg carton) - a tip I picked up from another reviewer, and I filled up to lowest mark on the measuring cup for medium eggs and immediately dunked them in a cold water bath to ensure that the eggs don’t over cook.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Best Boiled Eggs!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought me a Westbend Egg Cooker several years ago that I just loved. Well, when it died, after much use, It was no longer available so I bought a different brand, and was very disappointed as it undercooked the eggs consistently. I bought the Cuisinart, and much to my excitement, perfect eggs. It is well built too. I like that the dome is made of metal, as the others that I have had were plastic and cracked, and the handle for the dome fell off. On this one, the plastic parts are sturdier and not flimsy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley J. Toy

customer_reviews.title: Easy poached eggs
customer_reviews.text: We tried this contraption at my in laws in Hawaii so we ordered one for our place in Montana, it was a different brand but held more eggs, ended up going though a carton of eggs trying to get it right. Finally sent back and got this one, smaller but the same one. Works like a dream. I wish the water measurement cup didn’t have the pre determined lines cause they are useless; eggs cook different at elevations and I live a couple thousand feet above sea level, so if you live higher then make adjustments. Totally easy to make poached eggs in under 10 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lefebvre-Varzari

customer_reviews.title: NOT RELIABLE. You'll replace it in 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother. I've owned three if these. It just stops cooking all the way. Poof- suddenly it will shut off about mid cycle. Three different cookers. 1st time... yeah OK its a fluke.. buy another. 2nd time... hmmm same problem. Read the instructions again.. aha! 3rd time. Did EVERYTHING to the book in the instructions. Distilled water, cleaning with vinegar, blah blah blah - died YET AGAIN. Life shouldn't be this hard. Years ago I had a West Bend egg cooker that lasted from high school through college. I think I dropped it and it finally died. Thought this would be like that one. NOT RELIABLE
customer_reviews.author: Emory Salberg Sr

customer_reviews.title: This thing works great.
customer_reviews.text: We have a small poached egg preparing assembly that used on the gas stove. They can only do one poached egg at a time. Then I saw this device and all of the capabilities that it has. So far we've made many poached eggs. It can cook for another time. That's perfect for us. We can hard-boiled 10 eggs at a time. I haven't done that yet. I've also made several omelettes. So far everything turns out perfect as long as you follow the directions and put in the right amount of water.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly Every Time
customer_reviews.text: This unit is easy to use, my boiled eggs come out perfect every time, and are simple to peel. I've tried every egg boiling method out there and this is the first time I have consistently gotten easy to peel eggs. I highly recommend it. Just remember always to unplug the unit when the beeper goes off for safety. Wipe the surface with a little white vinegar then you are all set for the next time you need to cook eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Food Lover

customer_reviews.title: SAVES TIME AND IS THE BOMB!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I received my unit yesterday and immediatly hard boiled 7 eggs and they turned out perfect! This morning I soft boiled 2 eggs and again, perfect. Just remember that you need to poke a hole on the top of the egg and the TOP OF THE EGG IS THE LARGE END.....NOT THE POINTED END! This is very important or your eggs will it turn out right. Also, after use, wipe the mineral debris, from using tap water, off with some white vinegar and it’s as good as new for your next use.
customer_reviews.author: Tucci

customer_reviews.title: Works okay
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes it cooks the egg perfectly and sometimes it doesn't. One time I left it on and water splattered everywhere from the top. Now when I use it, I'm just waiting with it looking to see if it's going to splat water everywhere. Not a fan of the needle poking the egg before cooking it. Other brands have ones where you don't even need to poke a tiny hole. It's not hard, but I want convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Doing it this way they came out beautifully. No water leakage as when I put them ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried this little gadget 2 times and it leaked and cracked the eggs, but to my stupidity, you have to puncture the eggs on the top, the top being how the come in the carton. If you still don't get it it's the less pointy part of the egg. Doing it this way they came out beautifully. No water leakage as when I put them in wrong. The only problem I have it that you must turn it off after the beep or it will turn on again stupid design, but otherwise a great product. Sorry, this review is so long but if you don't put the eggs in right you will have a mess. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: R.A.Lee

customer_reviews.title: How Did We Manage Without This?
customer_reviews.text: We saw egg cookers in B&B’s all over Europe in 2017. I did my research and ordered this one as a gift to my husband (the cook) for Christmas that year. It works great plus it hold 12 eggs! We love it so much we gave our son the same one for Christmas this year. It isn’t one of those specialized items that take up space and you never use. It is compact and makes cooking eggs easy (you can also poach eggs or make omelettes in it but we haven’t used it for that yet). Pair it with The NEGG Boiled egg egg peeler available on Amazon and you will be in egg heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Margie Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for more than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The egg cooker worked well for 3 months and now the light and buzzer don't work resulting in overcooked eggs unless you're perfectly in tune to hearing the water evaporate. What a piece of garbage; this was only used about once a week for 3 months. DON'T buy. The last egg poacher I had lasted 15 years this only 3 months. Also an issue with the water leaking from the unit (and yes the cover is on correctly). Again, do NOT waste your money. Hard to contact, stayed on hold for an hour and gave up.
customer_reviews.author: KG1116

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!! Best money spent!
customer_reviews.text: I hate making hard boiled eggs only because the brown eggs never peel right. It’s tedious, it’s annoying and frustrating. But this?! Wow! Amazing and it peels like a dream. So easy to use, but you HAVE to follow directions. The eggs come from the container with the wide side up, puncture it and put in the steamer. You can’t do it any other way according to the manual and reviews. I am so impressed I am buying this for my mother and mother in law because we all complain about peeling eggs!
customer_reviews.author: Doreen P

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this was easy to use but the results were terrible. All of the eggs had cooked white that came out of the hole poked in the top as they advised and it got all over the plastic holders and the machine itself. DON'T GET THIS! There are other ones out there that are cheaper and probably don't explode and do a whole dozen at once. Now I have two uncooked eggs and I sure don't want to hard boil them again in this terrible machine.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: New favorite.
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite cooker. Completely satisfied. Easy to use. I have to play with it more but when the alarm goes off after 11 minutes or so the on off switch that moves left to right stays in the on position. I am not sure if it actually turned the heat off or not. I have to play with it more.
customer_reviews.author: Lonny

customer_reviews.title: This product is absolutely terrible. I can't believe Cuisinart could endorse a piece ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolutely terrible. I can't believe Cuisinart could endorse a piece of junk like this. When this product is used the following occurs: you punch a hole in the top of the egg and you are lucky not to break half the eggs. Then while you are boiling the eggs, part of the yolk comes out through the top of the egg and water comes out of the cooker all over the counter. Just grab a pan, place eggs in it and hard boil them, not complicated. This is a grand piece of junk which certainly diminishes the reputation of Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Product
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to purchase this as it seems superfluous but am so glad I did! The eggs cook perfectly but the best thing to me is the shells peel off easily and effortlessly. I bought this with a gift card back in January and have made more hard boiled eggs this year than ever. I agree with the other reviews to be sure to read the directions. This device is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Padme-Hum

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: when I was researching an egg cooker as a gift, I came across Dozens of models with different names, but many were the same egg cooker made in China. I decided to go with a brand I could trust. when it arrived, I discovered it was more compact than I thought ( a PLUS) and was very simple to operate and clean. It was a big hit as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: Best Hard-Boiled Eggs Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Makes absolutely PERFECT hard-boiled eggs. I haven't used it for anything else yet, but I'm looking forward to. Really happy with my purchase. The unit is nice and small so it's great for any size kitchen. It makes 10 eggs super fast, too. I highly recommend putting this on a kitchen towel and keep it out from under your cabinets, though. It lets off a lot of steam and can sputter and boil over a bit even when using the recommended measurement (with the provided cup) for hard-boiled eggs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Addict

customer_reviews.title: How did we live without one of these? We love the CEC-10 egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: I'm not big on kitchen gadgets so it's rare where I find that really changes how we prepare meals. Well I found one, it's an egg cooker and really need one and the CEC-10 has been absolutely perfect. Everything from hassle free hard boiled eggs to quick and easy bread pudding. Just get it, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Arless

customer_reviews.title: Worth the higher price
customer_reviews.text: More expensive than other egg cookers, but I'm very glad I bought it. Hard boiled eggs come out perfect every time, no green yokes. Omelettes are delicious though I only use 2 eggs. I prefer poached in silicon muffin cups in a pan of water instead of the tiny tray included.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Buy one if you enjoy cleaning off the counter and throwing eggs away!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used these “egg genies” before, but thought I’d try a better brand this time. This thing is a POS! The distilled water still leaves a nasty residue on the bottom of the pan, very hard to clean. I used it today for probably the 3rd time, and within a few minutes water was leaking out all over the counter, and the eggs were all oozing whites out of the shell. I’ve done this many times with my old (cheaper) unit, and never a problem, except that one too was hard to clean. This is going back, I hate it! Guess I’ll have to go back to the old boiling in the pan method.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Poached Eggs.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old egg cooker (1980’s era!) and it doesn’t come close to my old one. I love poached eggs and the egg tray that you would cook poached eggs in is so deep that the egg in the bottom of the cup is always runny and slimy. The cup is just too deep. If you add more water to cook longer, then the yolk gets cooked through. A shallow cup/tray is much better than this. Also, the small little handles on the side of the lid are not very helpful when removing the hot, steamed metal topper.
customer_reviews.author: Carla Urse

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Egg Cooker!
customer_reviews.text: We have been enjoying our egg cooker for a few weeks now! It's easy to use (follow the instructions), easy to clean (a little water and white vinegar mixture) and our eggs turn out perfect every time. We also gifted one to my partner's parents. They also love it. We have had no issues with eggs cracking, water overrunning or stains in at the bottom of the unit. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Oberon

customer_reviews.title: No more overcooked eggs!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife has a hard time cooking hard boiled eggs...basically to the point where the inside is a powder. I bought this for her and she loves it! Set it and forget it and just dump them in ice when the timer goes off...it's so easy. No guessing really. It does have the other features but we haven't used it for that yet. I like a soft boiled egg for my ramen and this does save me from getting a pot out and boiling water and then watching the eggs to make sure I see the boil and start a timer.
customer_reviews.author: brandan b.

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate Instructions
customer_reviews.text: I'm still experimenting with the proper water level to get my eggs to my liking. First try on Medium ended up Hard. Second try on the High mark for Soft; still too Hard. Next time I will try the Low Mark on Soft and see if this gives me a yolk that is thick but still soft.
customer_reviews.author: MOT Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: If you follow the directions, and poke holes in the top- fat end of the egg, it works perfectly. Easy clean-up. Boiled eggs cook quickly and are easy to peel. Only thing I watch is that the stainless steel lid does get hot, so be careful of the steam coming out of the lid when eggs are cooking, and when taking the lid off.
customer_reviews.author: Tybee

customer_reviews.title: Take plastic off needle & cook fat end up!!
customer_reviews.text: After finding out I didn't take the plastic off the needle first & you need to cook them fat end up as instructed, it worked a bunch better. i am still adjusting water level as egg yolks still show a tiny green and not sure why I get some burning on the bottom when done. If someone can tell me why, please lat me know. Otherwise, my eggs are delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie C

customer_reviews.title: It made perfect eggs in 12 minutes
customer_reviews.text: It is compact and does not take up counter space. I saw the You Tube video by Cuisinart and followed the directions. One thing I learned from other videos is to put the small side down of the eggs onto the tray. It made perfect eggs in 12 minutes! The egg pierce has a small clear color cap that comes on and off. You may loose it. It needs to be color coded to identify it is on otherwise it can be lost easily.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Best hard boiled eggs ever!
customer_reviews.text: I do enjoy hard boiled eggs but hate the struggle of removing the shell and having it "wreck" my perfect egg. Well, this is THE solution to that problem. I haven't tried the other cooking methods but highly recommend it for hard boiling technique. BTW, I use regular water, not distilled...hasn't affected my egg color or taste.
customer_reviews.author: Amy in L.A.

customer_reviews.title: I love my egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: I'm always pleased with the Cuisinart brand, and this Egg Cooker is no exception. I use it often. I like that I can cook 10 eggs at a time. Most cookers are 7 or 8. I always use distilled water, and I clean the water reservoir after each use with a little white vinegar. The egg piercer on the bottom of the water cup works well. My only complaint is that I wish it would turn itself off after the cooking cycle completes. It has a very loud, shrill beep that won't shut off until I go over and turn it off.
customer_reviews.author: HelinaFelina

customer_reviews.title: Cheeseburgers!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great for hardboiled eggs & omelettes, but it can be used for more than that. It also makes perfect steamed cheeseburgers, just press about 1/4 lb of seasoned ground beef in the omelette tray and follow the same instructions for omelettes. Once it's done, add your cheese to the top of the burger and replace lid for about 30 seconds, it will melt over it wonderfully. You can also make personal sized meatloaf the same way.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: EGG LOVERS, This is you’re machine!!
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing I dislike about this cute egg cooker!! Makes the very best hard boiled eggs, it’s amazing!! I use it to make little omelets too!! Quick, easy to use, and cooked perfect every time!! Makes the best flavored eggs, healthfully I’ve ever eaten!!!
customer_reviews.author: Deborah M. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Eggs
customer_reviews.text: I will never boil another egg on the stove!!! If you want perfect eggs that peal every time without a fuss, this egg cooker is for you. I have chickens, so when I have surplus eggs I pickle them. I already had a Cuisinart 7-egg cooker and bought this 10-egg cooker to make my job easier. I love it. Now I can cook 17 eggs at one time. That is a real time saver when I am processing 10 dozen eggs. If you don'r need to cook 10 eggs at a time, the 7-egg cooker works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Schultz

customer_reviews.title: You decide
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have is that the top (dome) does not lock (for storage). Dash egg cooker does a better job. Otherwise, it is a great product (so far).
customer_reviews.author: Arnie

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to any kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: Have tried other products and nothing works as well as this product. I love it for making hard boiled eggs. Cook perfectly every time. Easy to store and clean. Makes a great addition to any kitchen. Would also be a great gift for any bride to be.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously, get yourself an egg cooker. It's perfect for hard boiled or soft boiled eggs, especially if you have fresh eggs (we have our own egg layers). It's actually possible to PEEL the fresh eggs when they are done! If you've ever tried to peel hard-boiled farm fresh eggs, you know how frustrating it can be! Just don't bother much or count on the poached eggs function. It works fine, eggs are poached.... But they are kind of like egg jello when they are done. Gross. More than worth it just for boiled eggs!
customer_reviews.author: Lynnon Ruth

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: my mother in law makes killer deviled eggs and uses this to boil them. she places them in cool water after boiling and they peel relatively easily, and are perfectly done. doesn’t take up a lot of counter space, but does need to be cleaned between each use. doesn’t take much to do so, just a quick scrub of the metal inside. easy.
customer_reviews.author: hannah westphall

customer_reviews.title: Most useful kitchen aid I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered other gadgets in the past to try them once and not be impressed with them and put them in a cabinet to be forgotten. My sister in law recommended the Egg Central and I ordered one and love it. I ordered one for each of our kids and they love them. The eggs are cooked to your liking and the shells just slip off leaving an entire egg without loosing most of the white inside of the shell. All I can say is every cook needs one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cuisinart Egg Central. I purchased my first one approximately ten years ago and loved it. It worked fine until I accidentally left it on too long (I'd stepped outside and didn't hear the alarm when it had finished cooking). I've used my replacement a little over two months now and haven't experienced any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: CarolP913

customer_reviews.title: Worth it !!!
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love this thing !! Do not !!! Try to take the top off with one hand, you will reget it !!! I can add eggs and the right amount of water and while I'm getting dressed for work (appox 10 min) BAAM !! Eggs drop them in some cold water and easy peal
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: however the construction on this model is far superior. I love that the lower bowl is made ...
customer_reviews.text: This egg steamer works just as well as our previous steamer from another brand, however the construction on this model is far superior. I love that the lower bowl is made from stainless steel and can be thoroughly scrubbed clean without leaving any gross residue or damaging the bowl. Also, being able to cook 10 eggs at a time is great, as we often had to run two batches through our old machine that could only cook 7.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: No pin in measuring cup.
customer_reviews.text: Mine does not have a pin in the bottom of the mesure cup. Other than that it’s okay. Has not leaked like some said theirs did. I really would like to have the pin in the bottom. Only 3 stars because I have to use a needle.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: I could never get my hard boiled eggs to turn out right. I would always try different recipes, cooking times, etc. with no luck. My eggs were either not cooked enough or cooked too long. And trying to peel them frustrated me and took forever. Not with this. You have to follow the directions and also read the tips that come with the instructions. I use distilled water instead of the tap. I also clean after every use with vinegar. The biggest thing is to make sure your egg is positioned correctly. Great product - so happy I got this.
customer_reviews.author: Elm_H

customer_reviews.title: The Best egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: This is a great egg cooker. I bought another brand, but sent it back. It has a good cup marked well for poached and boiled. The poached eggs come out easily & done perfectly. The timer shuts it off (the other brand didn’t shut off). I’m happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: TAJ

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT, LOVE IT, LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: We love this egg cooker!! We bought a lot of these for Xmas presents for family and they love their egg cookers too! I spray some Pam Spray first before I pour the water for easy clean up with a paper towel and NO BURN MARKS! This machine cooks perfect hard boiled eggs that PEEL EASILY AND PERFECTLY EVERY SINGLE TIME!! I wish I had this machine all these years I've been making Deviled Eggs. What a miracle - seriously!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift... for you and for
customer_reviews.text: We have had two of these over 12 years and love the perfect hard boiled eggs. Gave one to our son for Christmas. This may seem like an unnecessary kitchen addition, but once you use it, you will never go back to the way you were preparing eggs before.
customer_reviews.author: B. S.C.

customer_reviews.title: The only working egg cooker on the market
customer_reviews.text: We used to have one of these, but we decided to try something new. Over the past few years we've tried about 5 different brands and styles. It not only works better that the others, it works while the others don't. Get the Egg and be happy.
customer_reviews.author: S. J. Heller

customer_reviews.title: Quality egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: Quick & easy to use, and I appreciated the quality. Nice looking stainless steel and a sharp egg piercer. I keep it stored in the box because it is easier to grasp & keep together. Don't waste your money on a less expensive egg cooker because it does not cook the eggs properly, and the egg piercer does not work.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Gaetani

customer_reviews.title: A perfect product.  LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Works like champion. I've never peeled eggs so perfectly and that fast. All 10 egges came out perfect and pristine. My wife cooked an omelet and it was perfect. It doesn't matter to me, but it looks nice in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: E. Freund

customer_reviews.title: Best omelet and fasted hard boiled eggs I've seen from ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh, my WOW! Best omelet and fasted hard boiled eggs I've seen from a machine. The omelet was good but the hard boiled eggs were perfect. Use distilled water or be sure to clean out the water try after each use or it leaves an ugly brown ring on your egg shell but that doesn't affect the taste at all. Also brown your veggies a bit if you want them pan-fried before adding to omelet. The best part is that I can mix up an omelet, jump in the shower and have it hot and ready when I get out! This will be great when RVing too. Really a great appliance.
customer_reviews.author: Shimon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hard boiled eggs
customer_reviews.text: I bought it specifically for making hard boiled eggs and that's all I've used it for so far. And for that task it's been incredible. Finally a reliable and fast way of getting perfect hard boil eggs every time. Consistently delicious whites and fluffy yolk (there's never a trace of that nasty green stuff which sometimes spoils yolk). Not only does it quickly make the best hard-boiled eggs I've ever tasted, but eggs made in it are also much easier to peel.
customer_reviews.author: Bill J.

customer_reviews.title: Great solution
customer_reviews.text: Only real issue is the discoloring that you will need to clean with vinegar. Doesn't matter if you use distilled or regular water. Works like a champ, great product. Wish it came in a bigger style.
customer_reviews.author: Just Tom

customer_reviews.title: It is a piece of Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: I did everything per the instructions. The light turned on when I turned on the unit, then in a couple of minutes the light turned off. The unit did not turn off and it did not heat the water. After an hour it just warmed up the water. The instructions show the parts with numbers from 1 to 7, with two number 7's. The instructions list parts from 1 to 10? Not very professional. Must be made in China. The unit is a piece of worthless junk!
customer_reviews.author: R. Huerta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hard-boiled eggs every time!
customer_reviews.text: Love this!! I bought this to make a batch of 10 hard-boiled eggs on a regular basis. Definitely be sure to use distilled water and use the provided water-measurer to puncture the eggs on the fat-end. The set-up takes five minutes, and it takes about 20 min for it to cook 10 hard-boiled eggs at a time. It beeps when it's done cooking, and then I put the eggs in cold ice water. The eggs come out perfectly every time! I haven't tried the poached egg trays or the omelet trays yet, but if they work as well as the hard-boiled egg system, they'll be great too.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny O

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME IN EVERY WAY!
customer_reviews.text: BEST INVENTION EVER!!!!!!! So easy and eggs turn out perfectly every time.
customer_reviews.author: Nadia Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed!
customer_reviews.text: While it's nice and compact and fits well in the kitchen - it only produces hard boiled eggs. If that's what you're going for great - if you want runny yokes and firm whites, this won't do it. The only way to adjust anything is to put less water in. That way when the water runs out they're supposedly less cooked. In reality that means you end up with hard yokes and runny whites - yuck!
customer_reviews.author: Book fans

customer_reviews.title: First time we tried it was water all over and ...
customer_reviews.text: First time we tried it was water all over and eggs were not done but then after reading other people reviews I gave it another try so apparently I didn't press down the lids correctly; no leaks at all and make sure I put the amount of water suggested and don't use tap water.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Garcia

customer_reviews.title: This is a huge safety issue and I am not sure what can be done to rectify the problem
customer_reviews.text: Hi I purchased this for Australia and it came with the American plug when it is plugged in Australia the heater element heats up far too quickly and turns itself off way too early leaving a burnt smell and the eggs either explode and remain raw I feel that this has been a total waste of money and wish it could be returned to amazon for a refund or even swapped for a full Australian version that can handle 240 volts it is actually a safety innuendo as if I had continued to try and use the cooker I think that it would have caught on fire.
customer_reviews.author: Lea Smit.

customer_reviews.title: Love this egg cooiker!
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to store eggs with the larger end facing up and cook them the same way as well. If you do this, there will not be water spilling out during cooking and the eggs will have a better chance not to crack/leak egg plus they will cook to your desired preference better. I love hard boiled with a evenly cooked yolk, with no green. This little egg cooked cooked them perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Tigges

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't sure I was going to like this when I used it the first two times
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure I was going to like this when I used it the first two times. The first time, I placed all the eggs small end up and didn't prick the top. Took 2 times to get the eggs to hard boil. The second time, I pricked the large end of the eggs, but caused big holes and cracked shells because I didn't remove the cover on the egg prick piece. Needless to say, that caused a mess and some embarrassment. After some serious baking soda to clean the mess up and remove the stain, i read through the comments below and got it right!! There is a small learning curve to this device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome egg cooker
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised from a known brand. It hasn't failed to do exactly what I asked it to do yet. However, after cooking, it does seem to leave a bit of "burn marks" on the heating plate (which are almost impossible to clean), which is no different than what you would see from any water heater. Other than that, no issues and still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Lodaka

customer_reviews.title: Used item shipped
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these and one is a repackaged used item that they didn't bother to clean. Aside from that, they work very well until the thermostat dies. They last about 5 years. The problem is that if an egg cracks and leaks albumin, the water foams and overflows. The thermostat gets wet and I guess it doesn't like that and eventually dies.
customer_reviews.author: igordworkin

customer_reviews.title: Easy and handy for hard boiled eggs
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife after she saw others using it to a make hard boiled eggs for a deviled food dish at a potluck. She loves it. Easy to use, although at first she was puncturing the egg too much. Each week she prepares the hard boiled eggs for salads and for breakfast. Very handy
customer_reviews.author: WiseLobo

customer_reviews.title: If you enjoy poached or hard boiled eggs
customer_reviews.text: If you enjoy poached or hard boiled eggs, this device is a no brainer. Hard Boiled eggs are extremely easy to peel, and this can make a batch of 7 in no time at all, with little to no mess. It also makes very good poached eggs (three at a time) with slightly more attention needed to be sure they do not harden the yoke. The poached eggs should be removed from the steamer as soon as the buzzer goes off. We have used this almost every day for the last 6 months or so. So good we bought a second one for our vacation home as well.
customer_reviews.author: davidmichaelboyle

customer_reviews.title: Great cooker!
customer_reviews.text: I love my hard boiled egg cooker! I found using distilled water helps it immensely as our local water is so hard and ruined 2 of my egg cookers. The cuisinart is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannette Helvey

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: A friend has an electric teapot, I'm not sure if it is the same model as this but it is similar. I bought this one and it works great. Very simple, fast to boil water, I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Lars E. LaVine

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Makes perfect hard or soft boiled eggs ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Makes perfect hard or soft boiled eggs and even though the area for poached eggs seemed small it works great with extra large eggs. You just need a very small spatula to get it out of the container and oil it well. Its a perfect size for the unit with the variety of things it does.
customer_reviews.author: pracdrp

customer_reviews.title: Love my Cuisinart Egg Central
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this device perfect eggs every single time. Quick and easy to use. I use distilled water when making my eggs and I also clean the base with cleaning vinegar after every use. When poking a hold in your Egg always use the fat side of the egg and you will not be disappointed with the outcome.
customer_reviews.author: MickeyAtl

customer_reviews.title: A must have egg cooker!
customer_reviews.text: Can't live without this. Egg cooking options on the fly. Always perfect. Poached, hard boiled, soft and omelettes to. Other recipes included. Keeping my old one in reserve.
customer_reviews.author: Pablito

customer_reviews.title: Definitely buy this, especially if you have men in your family that like boiled eggs.
customer_reviews.text: I love this! My man loves boiled eggs. He does not know how to boil water or eggs. So I bought him this. Come to find out, he doesn't know how to Boil eggs using this easy to operate Egg cooker either. I have used it many times, it is definitely one of my best small, kitchen appliance purchases. The eggs come out perfect, you can peel them with one hand, the eggshells just slide off.
customer_reviews.author: Charly

product_meta.title: Cuisinart CEC-10 Central Egg Cooker, normal, Brushed Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: The Cuisinart Egg Central appliance has a new two-tiered cooking system that allows ten eggs to be cooked at once. Eggs can be cooked to a hard, medium or soft consistency. The egg cooker also comes with removable trays that can be used to poach eggs and make omelets. Cooking time is controlled precisely by the amount of water added. Fill included measuring beaker to the appropriate range and pour water into cooking plate. The built-in LED light, audible alert, and standby mode help guard against overcooking. All egg favorites can be made in one compact unit.
feature_bullets: Cooks 10 eggs in shells to a hard, medium or soft consistency with the 600-watt heater
Poaching tray with 4-egg capacity and omelet tray with 3-egg capacity
Brushed stainless steel lid; blue LED indicator, audible alert and standby mode
Cooker includes a 180 ml measuring cup with piercing pin
Built-in cord storage for easy cleanup. MC Cubic Feet is 0.60

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,474 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
